alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 915 AM EDT... At 842 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Fairfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming and Mount Healthy. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 11 and 26. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 15 and 16. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 8 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
